Then Short Round is grabbed by the scruff of his neck and man hustles him out the door, Short Round yelling insults way. A maitre d' apologizes to the man in the tuxedo and two h girls smile at him familiarly as he continues into the ba We notice something incongruous:  the man in the tuxedo i ing work boots caked with mud.

As the man in the tuxedo walks toward the table, he remov cigarette from a silver case.  He arrives at the table ju the chorus and orchestra reach a crescendo -- And on the stage, a glistening, muscular slave swings a h mer toward an enormous brass gong -- The man in the tuxedo leans to receive a light from a cig girl and, as the GONG BOOMS, the match flares to reveal h for the first time: It's INDIANA JONES.  Elegant in a tuxedo -- dressed to ki TITLES END and over this a legend appears on the screen:

Dr. Jones.
Lao She.
Nee chin lie how ma?

Wah hung how, nee nah?  Wah hwey hung jing chee jah loo nee kao soo wah shu shu.
LAO SHE looks angry and his men's smiles fade.

I don't like to show off.
Indiana takes a seat across the table from Shanghai's not crime-lord.  Lao is fifty, wealthy enough to now display fat, but still muscular from his fight to the top of the heap.
For this special occasion, I ordered champagne and caviar.

Indiana looks at the pile of caviar on the plate in front -- and stubs his cigarette out in it.  The cigarette sizz Lao's smiles dies with it. There's applause as Wille Scott finishes her song.  At th table, Lao stares at Indiana with a strange intensity.
So, it is true, Dr. Jones?  you found Nurhachi?
Sure, I found him.  Then last night I had a little trouble. Somebody tried to slit my throat.
Indiana looks across the table at Lao's son, CHEN, who re a bulldog and snarls like one now. INDIANA (Cont'd) It was dark, but I think one of your sons tried to get Nurhachi without paying for him.
Indy stares pointedly at Chen's recently bandaged hand. mutters and stands angrily -- Lao barks a command in Chin Chen sits down again.
You have insulted my son.
Next time I'll cut off more than his finger.
Dr. Jones -- I want Nurhachi.
Lao pulls a wad of cash out of his pocket and puts it on table.  Indiana glances at it.
As I recall the deal was consid- erably more.
Now a pretty hand slips onto Lao's shoulder and he looks see Willie Scott.  Lao kisses her hand.  Willie is unawar explosive mood at the table and she smiles flirtaciously ana.
(to Lao) Aren't you going to introduce us?
This is Willie Scott. (watching Indy) And this is Indiana Jones, the famous archaeologist.
Willie sits down between Lao and Indy.  She takes out a s mirror to check her make-up. LAO (Cont'd) Dr. Jones found Nurhachi for me and is about to deliver him -- now.
Lao nods across the table and Indy sees KAO KAN, Lao's se son, open his coat and remove a silver-plated pistol.  In looks worried.  Willie doesn't notice as she fixes her ma and coyly teases Indiana.
Well -- I thought archaeologists were always funny little men searching for their mummies -- (yelping) Aaahhh!
She looks down terrified at the knife Indy is poking agai ribs. WILLE (Cont'd) I was only kidding, can't you take a joke -- ? (to Lao) Lao, he's got a knife!
Put the gun away, sonny.
Kao Kan glances at his father.  Lao finally nods to his s he slips the pistol back into his pocket.
Now I suggest you pay me what you promised -- or your girlfriend here is going to be squealing a new tune.

The ritzy patrons at the tables nearby are unaware of the drama quietly unfolding at this table. Willie eyes the blade and whimpers.  She looks imploringl and he slowly reaches into his pocket.  He puts ten gold next to the cash on the table. Indy leans forward to look at the gold coins -- so intent he fails to notice Kao Kan spilling some powder into Indy pagne glass!
Try again Lao -- the deal was more.

The knife pokes Willie and she whimpers again.  Lao reach another pocket and brings out a folded piece of rice pape opens it and a large diamond and ruby spill out onto the INDIANA (Cont'd) Bingo...you see, Lao, with a but of persuasion, even you can be an honest fellow.

Indy smiles and jabs the knife into the middle of the tab Then he lifts his champagne glass in a toast to Lao -- wh watches expectantly as Indiana moves the glass toward his Suddenly Willie stands angrily, jostling Indy's arm so th doesn't drink his champagne.
Look at this!  He put a hole in my dress from Paris!
Lao sees Indy put his champagne glass down and he snarls lie --
Sit down!
Willie quickly obeys.  Lao forces a smile at Indy and lif glass to seal the deal -- LAO (Cont'd) To your health, Dr. Jones.

Lao sips hs champagne and watches hopefully as Indy picks glass and this time Indy does drink the champagne. Then h reaches for the cash -- But Chen grins and puts a silver snuff bottle next to the gold and jewels -- he tips the little bottle over and som powder spills out of it --
What's that?
A bonus, Dr. Jones.  That is poison.  You just drank the rest of it.

Indiana examines his champagne glass and sees a residue a bottom of it.  He swallows and feels sick, wondering it i or the poison already taking effect. LAO (Cont'd) There is an antidote for this poison.  You give me Nurhachi -- I give you the antidote.
Indiana is sweating.  Willie looks at him and sees Indy's shaking. LAO (Cont'd) The poison works fast, Dr. Jones. Where is Nurhachi?
Indiana finally reaches into his pocket.  Next to the cas jewels and poison, Indiana sets down a beautiful small bo and his men stare hypnotically at the exquisite gold and box.
(nervously) This Nurhachi's a very small guy.
Nobody pays any attention to her as Lao reaches for the b
Inside are the remains of Nur- hachi -- the first Emperor of the Manchu Dynasty.
Lao opens the box carefully and stares reverently at the powder inside. INDIANA (Cont'd) Now what about the antidote, Lao.
(holding the box) At last I have the ashes of my sacred ancestor!
So, what's the big deal?  Let me see it --
Qillie grabs Lao's arm and some of the precious ashes spi of the gold box.  Stunned by this desecration of his ance Lao grabs Willie by the wrist and twists her arm --
You fool!
Ow, you're hurting me, you miser- able little hood!
Let go of her, Lao.  And give me the antidote.

Lao just laughs evilly -- until a waiter moves up behind the crimelord suddenly stiffens.  He lets go of Willie's and raises his hands off the table.  Chen stops collectin money and jewels. Kao Kan tenses and Indy smiles at Wu Han, the Chinese wai the scar, who is standing behind Lao.  Wu Han has a towel his hand  --  under it, he has a pistol pressed against L spine. INDIANA (Cont'd) (smiling at Wu Han) I like the service here.
(puzzled) Hey, he's not a waiter...
No, Wu Han's an old friend I brought along. (to Lao) So, the game's not over. Put the antidote on the table, Lao.

Lao carefully reaches into his pocket and puts a small gl of liquid next to the cash, gold, jewels, poison and sacr Indy looks relieved as he reaches for the vial of antidot then he hears a muffled report!  And another! Wu Han groans and sways.  Indy starts to stand but Chen i ately turns the smoking pistol with the silencer that he kill Wu Han -- Indy sees it pointed at him now and he rem his seat. The nightclub activity continues an Indy emotionally to his dying friend.
Wu Han  --  listen to me  --  I'm going to get you out of here.
In pain, Wu Han looks at Indy and struggles to speak --
Not this time, my friend... (smiling bravely) I followed you on many adventures -- but into the great Unknown Mystery, I go first, Indy...
Wu Han dies and slumps forward.  Indiana is shattered by death of his old friend.
Don't be sad, Dr. Jones -- you will soon join him.

Indy's gaze shifts from his dead friend to Lao's sneering Then Indy sees the murderous Chen giggling perversely.  I anger is compounded by the poison burning in his gut and ion of Chen's ugly face blurs into a double image -- Indy stands up unsteadily.  Chen assumes he's about to ke from the poison -- but Indy suddenly turns and grabs a re ter at another table. Chen fires and misses -- and screams as the skewe into his chest and the burning pigeons flame in front of rified face! This the other tables definitely notice.  There are screa all hell breaks loose.  Indiana shoves past Willie and re for the vial on the table --
The antidote -- !

But he's grabbed from behind by Kao Kan.  Indy elbows the reaches back and grabs his head -- and somersaults Kao Ka the table! Meanwhile, Willie is chasing her diamond, shoving through panicked crowd.  She spots the diamond!  Another elegantl dresses soman is bending to pick it up --
(acidly polite) Excuse me, but I believe that's my diamond!

Oh yeah?

The machine gun explodes to life, che bullets, smoking and spitting shells at Willie -- Willie hollers terrified by manages to feed the ammo belt Short Round sights the blazing machine gun -- suddenly he Willie sees the fighter hit -- it smokes and veers away - then EXPLODES!
I get it!

Indy?
Okay, Shorty.

No... I'm not cut out for the kind of life you lead. (moaning) Oh no...I ripped my dress.  Where are we anyway?
The raft floats to a gentle stop -- we see it nudge again pair of dark feet.  Indy squints up into the sun and sees thing.
India...
Holy cow -- India?  How do you know we're in --

Silhoutted against the blazing sun, th ny little old man in a loincoloth stares down at them in An eerie wind rises and howls.  The old man places his pa gether and moves his hands up to touch his forehead.  Wil Short Round watch mystified as Indiana returns the old sh silent greeting.

Indya and Short Round follow the shaman and four peasants gutted path through barren rolling hills.  Willie is out milieu, stumbling along this forlorn landscape in high he tuxedo jacket and disheveled lame gown. She hears the old shaman talking to Indy and catches up w to find out what's going on.

He told me they knew I was coming here.
What do you mean -- how?

Dream -- nightmare is more like it.
He said that's whey they were at river -- they were waiting for the plane to fall down.
He looks at her bewildered face and smiles faintly.  As t walk, a hot wind swirls dust around them,  a wind slowly what soil is left in this terribly blighted region.
